alert.note: Alert for Pima; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued September 12 at 3:52PM MST until September 12 at 4:30PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northern Pima County in southeastern Arizona... South central Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 430 PM MST. * At 351 PM MST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 19 miles east of Santa Rosa, or 33 miles west of Marana, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly remote areas of northern Pima and south central Pinal Counties. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
